Welcome to my homepage! My name is Haoyu Zhang, a postdoc in the Department of Biostatistics  at Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health working with Xihong Lin on statistical genetics and COVID-19 analysis. Currently, I am interested in addressing the weak intruments bias in Mendelian Randomization, developing multi-ethnic polygenic risk scores, and quantifying the COVID-19 tranmission pattern on U.S. states and county level data.
I received my Ph.D. from the Department of Biostatistics at Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health under the guidance of Nilanjan Chatterjee and Ni Zhao. I also received the graduate student fellowship from National Cancer Institute under the guidance of Montserrat Garc√≠a-Closas. My Phd dissertation focused on testing for genetic association and building risk prediction models for cancer incorporating tumor characteristics. I led several multidisciplinary international collaborations using the largest breast cancer GWAS dataset from the Breast Cancer Association Consortium.
